segment.source: Manage Configurations for UE-V 2.x
segment.target: Manage Configurations for UE-V 2.x

segment.source: Manage Configurations for UE-V 2.x
segment.target: Manage Configurations for UE-V 2.x

segment.source: Manage Configurations for UE-V 2.x
segment.target: Manage Configurations for UE-V 2.x

segment.source: In the course of the Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0, 2.1, or 2.1 SP1 lifecycle, you have to manage the configuration of the UE-V Agent and also manage storage locations for resources such as settings package files.
segment.target: In the course of the Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0, 2.1, or 2.1 SP1 lifecycle, you have to manage the configuration of the UE-V Agent and also manage storage locations for resources such as settings package files.

segment.source: You might have to perform other tasks, for example, configuring the Company Settings Center to define how users interact with UE-V.
segment.target: You might have to perform other tasks, for example, configuring the Company Settings Center to define how users interact with UE-V.

segment.source: The following topics provide guidance for managing these UE-V resources.
segment.target: The following topics provide guidance for managing these UE-V resources.

segment.source: Configuring UE-V 2.x by using Group Policy Objects
segment.target: Configuring UE-V 2.x by using Group Policy Objects

segment.source: You can use Group Policy Objects to modify the settings that define how UE-V synchronizes settings on computers.
segment.target: You can use Group Policy Objects to modify the settings that define how UE-V synchronizes settings on computers.

segment.source: Configuring UE-V 2.x with Group Policy Objects
segment.target: Configuring UE-V 2.x with Group Policy Objects

segment.source: Configuring UE-V 2.x with System Center Configuration Manager 2012
segment.target: Configuring UE-V 2.x with System Center Configuration Manager 2012

segment.source: You can use System Center 2012 Configuration Manager to manage the UE-V Agent by using the UE-V 2 Configuration Pack.
segment.target: You can use System Center 2012 Configuration Manager to manage the UE-V Agent by using the UE-V 2 Configuration Pack.

segment.source: Configuring UE-V 2.x with System Center Configuration Manager 2012
segment.target: Configuring UE-V 2.x with System Center Configuration Manager 2012

segment.source: Administering UE-V 2.x with PowerShell and WMI
segment.target: Administering UE-V 2.x with PowerShell and WMI

segment.source: UE-V provides Windows PowerShell cmdlets, which can help administrators perform various UE-V tasks.
segment.target: UE-V provides Windows PowerShell cmdlets, which can help administrators perform various UE-V tasks.

segment.source: Administering UE-V 2.x with Windows PowerShell and WMI
segment.target: Administering UE-V 2.x with Windows PowerShell and WMI

segment.source: Configuring the Company Settings Center for UE-V 2.x
segment.target: Configuring the Company Settings Center for UE-V 2.x

segment.source: You can configure the Company Settings Center that is installed by using the UE-V Agent to define how users interact with UE-V.
segment.target: You can configure the Company Settings Center that is installed by using the UE-V Agent to define how users interact with UE-V.

segment.source: Configuring the Company Settings Center for UE-V 2.x
segment.target: Configuring the Company Settings Center for UE-V 2.x

segment.source: Examples of configuration settings for UE-V 2.x
segment.target: Examples of configuration settings for UE-V 2.x

segment.source: Here are some examples of UE-V configuration settings:
segment.target: Here are some examples of UE-V configuration settings:

segment.source: Settings Storage Path: Specifies the location of the file share that stores the UE-V settings.
segment.target: Settings Storage Path: Specifies the location of the file share that stores the UE-V settings.

segment.source: Settings Template Catalog Path: Specifies the Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path that defines the location that was checked for new settings location templates.
segment.target: Settings Template Catalog Path: Specifies the Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path that defines the location that was checked for new settings location templates.

segment.source: Register Microsoft Templates: Specifies whether the default Microsoft templates should be registered during installation.
segment.target: Register Microsoft Templates: Specifies whether the default Microsoft templates should be registered during installation.

segment.source: Synchronization Method: Specifies whether UE-V uses the sync provider or "none".
segment.target: Synchronization Method: Specifies whether UE-V uses the sync provider or "none".

segment.source: The "SyncProvider" supports computers that are disconnected from the network.
segment.target: The "SyncProvider" supports computers that are disconnected from the network.

segment.source: "None" applies when the computer is always connected to the network.
segment.target: "None" applies when the computer is always connected to the network.

segment.source: For more information about the Sync Method, see Sync Methods for UE-V 2.x.
segment.target: For more information about the Sync Method, see Sync Methods for UE-V 2.x.

segment.source: Synchronization Timeout: Specifies the number of milliseconds that the computer waits before time-out when it retrieves the user settings from the settings storage location.
segment.target: Synchronization Timeout: Specifies the number of milliseconds that the computer waits before time-out when it retrieves the user settings from the settings storage location.

segment.source: Synchronization Enable: Specifies whether the UE-V settings synchronization is enabled or disabled.
segment.target: Synchronization Enable: Specifies whether the UE-V settings synchronization is enabled or disabled.

segment.source: Maximum Package Size: Specifies a settings package file threshold size in bytes at which the UE-V Agent reports a warning.
segment.target: Maximum Package Size: Specifies a settings package file threshold size in bytes at which the UE-V Agent reports a warning.

segment.source: Don’t Sync Windows App Settings: Specifies that UE-V should not synchronize Windows apps.
segment.target: Don’t Sync Windows App Settings: Specifies that UE-V should not synchronize Windows apps.

segment.source: Enable/Disable First Use Notification: Specifies whether UE-V displays a dialog box the first time that the UE-V Agent runs on a user’s computer.
segment.target: Enable/Disable First Use Notification: Specifies whether UE-V displays a dialog box the first time that the UE-V Agent runs on a user’s computer.

segment.source: Enable/Disable Tray Icon: Specifies whether UE-V displays an icon in the notification area and any notifications associated with it.
segment.target: Enable/Disable Tray Icon: Specifies whether UE-V displays an icon in the notification area and any notifications associated with it.

segment.source: The icon provides a link to the Company Settings Center.
segment.target: The icon provides a link to the Company Settings Center.

segment.source: Custom Contact IT Hyperlink: Defines the path, text, and description for the Contact IT hyperlink in the Company Settings Center.
segment.target: Custom Contact IT Hyperlink: Defines the path, text, and description for the Contact IT hyperlink in the Company Settings Center.

segment.source: Got a suggestion for UE-V?
segment.target: Got a suggestion for UE-V?

segment.source: Add or vote on suggestions here.
segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.target: For UE-V issues, use the UE-V TechNet Forum.
